scheme_name: State Level Awards for Divyang Persons
brief_description: Under this scheme, a cash prize of ₹8,000, along with a medal and a certificate of appreciation, is awarded to outstanding individuals in categories such as disabled employees, outstanding sportspersons, and best self-employed service providers.
detailed_description: The scheme "State Level Awards for Divyang Persons" is implemented by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, to honor the exceptional achievements and contributions of persons with disabilities in various fields. Under this scheme, a cash prize of ₹8,000, along with a medal and a certificate of appreciation, is awarded to outstanding individuals in categories such as disabled employees, outstanding sportspersons, and best self-employed service providers. The awards are distributed annually on the occasion of World Disability Day (December 3) to recognize and encourage excellence among persons with disabilities.
benefits: An amount of ₹8000/- is given as a cash prize. Medal and Certificate of Appreciation.
The amount disbursed through the cheque or bank draft at the award ceremony.
Awarded annually on December 3 (World Disability Day).
eligibility_criteria:
The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand. The applicant should be a person with a disability. The applicant should have verifiable records of achievements or work. The applicant should be in any one of the following categories:
Differently-abled (Divyang) employee Outstanding Sportsperson Best Self-Employed Service Provider

steps: Applications are invited via public notice or advertisement in newspapers before December 3 each year. Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the District Social Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Social Welfare Officer. Note: For this award, applications are invited in newspapers. Post-application Process Verification: District-level verification of documents and achievements is carried out. Screening and Recommendation: Verified applications are forwarded with recommendations to the Director, Social Welfare. A screening committee at the state government level evaluates and selects eligible candidates in each category. Award Distribution: The awards are distributed on the occasion of World Disability Day on 3rd December.

documents_required: Identity proof Photographs Disability Certificate Detailed Description of Achievements or Contributions (in the relevant category) Any Other Documents If Required
